teaItems.name: Black Tea
teaItems.description: Typically more robust and pronounced flavors. And when brewed appropriately, a higher caffeine content compared to other teas.

teaItems.name: Green Tea
teaItems.description: Green teas tend to have less caffeine (10-30% of coffee). Greens also tend to produce more subtle flavors with many undertones and accents that connoisseurs treasure.

teaItems.name: Earl Grey Tea
teaItems.description: Earl Grey is one of the most recognized flavored teas in the world.

teaItems.name: Chamomile Tea
teaItems.description: Calming chamomile has been around for ages, dating back thousands of years, at least to ancient Egyptian times. It is most famously known as a relaxing herb.

teaItems.name: Jasmine Tea
teaItems.description: The world soon fell in love with jasmineâ€™s perfumed aroma and delicate flavor and has been craving the glorious blossom ever since.

teaItems.name: Chai Tea
teaItems.description: The Hindi term chai means a mix of spices steeped into a tea-like beverage.
